questions.question_text: An engineer must attach an ESXi host to the Cisco ACI fabric. The host is connected to Leaf 1 and has its gateway IP address 10.10.10.254/24 configured inside the ACI fabric. A new firewall is attached to Leaf 2 and mapped to the same EPG and BD as the ESXi host. The engineer must migrate the gateway of the ESXi host to the firewall. Which configuration set accomplishes this goal?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
This configuration allows seamless migration of gateway functionality from ACI to the firewall without disrupting connectivity for devices within the subnet.

Selected Answer: B
B of course
i thought this should be B?

choices.C:
Enable unicast routing.
Configure IP address 10.10.10.254/24 on the ACI EPG.
choices.D:
Enable unicast routing.
Set IP address 10.10.10.254/24 on the firewall.
choices.B:
Disable unicast routing.
Define IP address 10.10.10.254/24 on the firewall.
choices.A:
Disable unicast routing.
Configure IP address 10.10.10.254/24 on the ACI BD.

questions.question_text:
A VM called App_1 belongs to VLAN 10. VM App_2 belongs to VLAN 20. Pool_1 contains VLAN 10 and Pool_2 contains VLAN 20. Currently, AP_1 is located on Server 1. The Cisco ACI fabric has these configurations:

• The two physical domains are called Phys_1 and Phys_2.
• The two VLAN pools are called Pool_1 and Pool_2.
• The two AAEPs are called AAEP_1 and AAEP_2.

An engineer must replace App_1 with App_2. Which action under the VPC interface policy group accomplishes this goal?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
In Cisco ACI, Attachable Access Entity Profiles (AAEPs) are used to map VLAN pools and physical domains to interfaces. When replacing App_1 (VLAN 10) with App_2 (VLAN 20), the correct AAEP must be attached to the VPC interface policy group to ensure that the appropriate VLAN pool and physical domain are applied.

Selected Answer: C
Attach the AEEP_2 to vPC.

Selected Answer: C
Cannot assign VLAN Pool to an Interface Policy Group but can attach an AAEP

Selected Answer: D
The difference of enabling and disabling the ARP flooding option appears once ACI learns a silent host IP. One of the benefits of enabling ARP flooding is to be able to detect a silent IP that moved from one location to another without notifying an ACI leaf. Because the ARP request is flooded within the BD, even if the ACI leaf still thinks the IP is at the old location, the host with the silent IP would respond appropriately so that the ACI leaf can update its entry accordingly. If ARP flooding is disabled, the ACI leaf would keep forwarding the ARP request only to the old location until the IP endpoint ages out. On the other hand, the benefit of disabling ARP flooding is to be able to optimize traffic flow by sending the ARP request directly to the location of the target IP, assuming no endpoint moves without notifying its movement via GARP and such.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/solutions/collateral/data-center-virtualization/application-centric-infrastructure/white-paper-c11-739989.html#Silenthostsconsiderations

For (L3) routed traffic to an unknown IP, the ACI leaf will generate an ARP request from its BD SVI (pervasive gateway) IP toward the unknown IP in order to detect and learn the unknown IP. Only the leaf with BD SVI IP for the unknown IP subnet will generate an ARP request. This behavior is originally triggered by the spine when the spine couldn’t find the unknown IP, even in the COOP database. This behavior is called silent host detection, or ARP gleaning. This behavior for (L3) routed traffic happens regardless of configuration, such as L2 Unknown Unicast or ARP flooding (mentioned below), as long as the traffic is routed to an unknown IP.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/solutions/collateral/data-center-virtualization/application-centric-infrastructure/white-paper-c11-739989.html#Silenthostsconsiderations

questions.question_text: A Cisco ACI fabric with an ARP packet must ensure detection of silent hosts with an ARP packet. The current bridge domain is configured with hardware proxy and unicast routing. Which step must be taken on the bridge domain to complete the configuration?

choices.A: Set Optimized Flood for L3 Unknown Multicast.
choices.C: Set L2 Unknown Unicast to Flood.
choices.D: Enable ARP Flooding in the bridge domain.
choices.B: Enable Flood in the bridge domain for Multi Destination Flooding.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Tenants > mgmt > Contracts > Out Of Band Contracts, apply in provided direction to Node Management EPG
Tenants > mgmt > External Management Network Instance Profiles -> apply the contract in consumed direction and add subnets
Make sure HTTPS and SSH are enabled in Fabric > Fabric Policies > Policies > Pod > Management Access

choices.B:
Set up static IPs on the management interfaces from the required IP range.
Add the required subnets to the external network instance profile.
choices.D:
Create an out-of-band EPG in the common tenant.
Associate the external network instance profile with the OOB contract.
choices.A:
Implement HTTPS and SSH protocol filters in the OOB contract.
Add the required subnets to the external network instance profile.
choices.C:
Create an out-of-band EPG in the external management entity.
Associate the management profile with the OOB contract.

questions.question_text:
An engineer is implementing an out-of-band (OOB) management access for the Cisco ACI fabric. The secure access must meet these requirements:

• Only GUI and secure shell must be allowed to access the management interfaces of the ACIs.
• The only IP ranges that must be permitted to connect the fabric will be 10.10.10.0/24 and 192.168.15.0/24.

Which configuration set meets these requirements?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
By enabling Global AES Encryption and ensuring secure data inclusion, you can safely back up and restore the Cisco ACI fabric configuration, including the vCenter password.

choices.B: Select SCP protocol for the remote location.
choices.C: Enable the Global AES Encryption setting.
choices.D: Set the Authentication type to Use Password.

questions.question_text: A Cisco ACI fabric is integrated with a VMware environment. The engineer must back up the current configuration of the fabric and restore the vCenter password when the configuration is imported. Which action accomplishes this goal?
